Posts.Content: On 5/22/2007 Amy jo wrote: My mother is 57 years old and she has stage 4 breast cancer that also occupies her lungs, liver and now her spine and brain.  She has been taking chemo for almost 3 years and just completed a round of radiation.  I keep hearing about cesium chloride but I am scared of it also.  We are running out of options.  Please let me know if anyone has any experience with this.   Just curious if you found out anything further on this. My mom has gone through the lumpectomy,(don't worry it's so small), to 1 1/2 yrs later a small(once again don't worry it's so small), to a Mastectomy. Then a couple of years later to her spine & hip. Was some in the sac around her heart. Now they say it's in her spinal fluid, pelvis & will hit her brain soon. She's had lots of Chemo & Radiation, all with suppossedly good results. Now she has bad vision problems, losing more weight, lots of nasuea & starting to lose brain function. It has been 7 LONG years. THey gave her 3-6 months, maybe a month or 2 longer if she had a port in her head. She is tired & doesn't want that. BUT if Cesium-Chloride works, I do it. I just wonder if this is stuff from a quack? Reading from some of the sites on the net, it doesn't look too good. Please let me know if you have heard to the contray. My thoughts & prayers are with you for you & your mom.
Posts.Title: cesium chloride-should my mom take it?
